title: RPO Zeeshan meets FPJA president Tahir Najafi
content:
ISLAMABAD, Oct 08 (APP):Regional Police Officer (RPO) Faisalabad Zeeshan Asghar held a cordial meeting with Faisalabad Photojournalists’ Association (FPJA) President Muhammad Tahir Najafi. The meeting highlighted mutual respect, professionalism, and a shared commitment to promoting art and journalism.
PJA President Tahir Najafi told APP on Wednesday that the interaction was not merely a formal courtesy call but a meaningful exchange on the importance of photojournalism and cultural representation in Pakistan. He praised RPO Zeeshan Asghar for his courteous demeanor, refined personality, and appreciation of creative expression.
RPO Zeeshan Asghar lauded Tahir Najafi’s services to the field of photojournalism, acknowledging his international recognition, including a Gold Medal from the United Nations International Photography Council. He said that professional photographers play a vital role in projecting a positive image of Pakistan worldwide.
During the meeting, Tahir Najafi shared his experiences in international photography and spoke about ongoing photo exhibitions and workshops in universities aimed at inspiring the youth and raising artistic awareness.
RPO Zeeshan Asghar appreciated these initiatives and termed such creative professionals as a valuable national asset. He said that cities like Faisalabad thrive when honest, dedicated, and artistic individuals contribute to their social and cultural growth.
Tahir Najafi added that RPO Zeeshan Asghar’s integrity, sincerity, and artistic vision made the meeting truly memorable, noting that such officers are a source of pride for the people of Faisalabad.
